item.title: Konsave TUI
item.description: Intro # I have recently stumbled upon a handy little tool for us who love customizing KDE but hate the work of switching between rices… It’s called KonSave. As you can see from above video, tool is very useful.

item.title: LightlyShaders Effects
item.description: What is it ? # I would like to share a neat little “Effect” if you will, called LightlyShaders which is fork of another project that is a simple KWin/5 effect that simply rounds corners of windows, to do this it uses an opengl shader and is able to round any window, like mpv video for example will have rounded corners.

item.title: Make KDE apps use System theme in XFCE/Gnome
item.description: Info # In case you are one of the affected people, below is how you can fix the issue. I have tested it and it works fine. And keep in mind that XeroLinux is basically ArchLinux so below fix will work on Arch as well as any Arch-Based distros with the exception of Manjaro that is NOT Arch… Read more on that » Here «

item.title: Make KDE apps use System theme in XFCE/Gnome
item.description: Intro # As I was working on XFCE & Gnome, I noticed that since they both use GTK3/4, some QT apps made for KDE like KdenLive did not follow the system theme.

item.title: ML4W Plasma + Hyprland side-by-side
item.description: What is it ? # Our good friend from ML4W just posted a video showing us how to have both Plasma 6 and Hyprland side-by-side with his awesome dotfiles.. Check it out below with a link to his repos…

item.title: Wallpaper Engine for Plasma
item.description: Intro # I have always wanted to use cool animated wallpapers on Linux. Found many free ways, but nothing rivaled the awesome features of Wallpaper Engine found on steam for the low price of $5.
